page.title: 05BLACKNESS PROJECT, DUNDEE
page.content: { The Blackness Project,1981-84,}was a joint exercise by the SDA,DDC & TRC designed to regenerate a decaying industrial area. It involved{building {of new factory units,conversion and {improvement of existing premises, {clearing and landscaping of derelict {land and provision of finance to {assist firms.}It has reversed the decline in the fabric of the area and by 1984 there had been a net increase of approx. 50 firms. In the area there are approx. 160 establishments, employing around 300 people, of whom only 75 are in textiles. From 1975 _ 1981 the DDC has spent Â£1.5 million in the acquisition and demolition of derelict buildings, site preparation and the provision of 56 small advanced factory units, of which 21 are now occupied. By 1984, Â£8 million will have been spent.
